alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:42PM EDT until April 12 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated nearly stationary thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 7 and 12 inches of rain have fallen from these nearly stationary thunderstorms and additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Fort Lauderdale airport continues to report that the main roadways entering and exiting are flooded and impassable at this time. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Lauderhill, Dania Beach, Chula Vista, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Ravenswood Estates, Melrose Park, Estates Of Fort Lauderdale, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Washington Park, Broadview Park, Franklin Park, Port Everglades, Oak Point, Chambers Estates and St. George. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
